quizzes.question: Which two of the following font types are supported in Firefox, Safari, and Chrome?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The @font-face Rule[/h1]

The [b]@font-face[/b] rule allows custom fonts to be loaded into a webpage. 
With the help of this rule, designs are no longer limited to the fonts that are installed on a user's computer. 

In Internet Explorer 8 and earlier, the URL must point to an [b]Embedded OpenType[/b] (eot) file, while Firefox, Chrome, etc. support [b]True Type Fonts[/b] (ttf) fonts and [b]OpenType Fonts[/b] (otf). [img id="2685" width="100%"]
